required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ATTR Expanded Access Program (EAP) by Ionis
clinical_study.official_title: Expanded Access Program for Inotersen (ISIS 420915) in Patients With Hereditary Transthyretin Amyloidosis (hATTR)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this program is to provide expanded access to Inotersen for up to 100 Patients with Hereditary Transthyretin Amyloidosis (hTTR).

detailed_description.textblock: The Program is intended to provided expanded access to Inotersen for eligible patients with hATTR who have limited or no available treatment options.

intervention.description: Inotersen administered by subcutaneous (SC) injections in the abdomen, thigh, or upper arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female at least 18 years of age with a diagnosis of hATTR
- Symptoms consistent with polyneuropathy
- Meet Polyneuropathy Disability (PND) Stage I-III requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known Primary Amyloidosis, Leptomeningeal Amyloidosis or Monoclonal Gammopathy of Undetermined Significance or Multiple Myeloma
- Have inadequate cardiac function
- Have low platelet counts
- Have inadequate renal function
